bayStackSourceGuardMib.name: bayStackSourceGuardMib
bayStackSourceGuardMib.description: This MIB module is used for IP Source Guard settings in Nortel's software and products.

bsSourceGuardConfigTable.name: bsSourceGuardConfigTable
bsSourceGuardConfigTable.description: This table is used to configure IP Source Guard per port.

bsSourceGuardConfigEntry.name: bsSourceGuardConfigEntry
bsSourceGuardConfigEntry.description: An entry containing objects for configuring IP Source Guard settings for a port.

bsSourceGuardConfigIfIndex.name: bsSourceGuardConfigIfIndex
bsSourceGuardConfigIfIndex.description: The interface on which Source Guard configuration setting apply.

bsSourceGuardConfigMode.name: bsSourceGuardConfigMode
bsSourceGuardConfigMode.description: This object is used to control the Source Guard mode on an interface. The values are as follows: disabled(1) - Source Guard is disabled on this interface. ip(2) - Source Guard only allows traffic from a list of IP addresses on this interface.

bsSourceGuardAddrTable.name: bsSourceGuardAddrTable
bsSourceGuardAddrTable.description: This table contains a list of internet and/or MAC addresses allowed by Source Guard on an interface. An entry in this table must indicate either a valid internet address and/or a valid MAC address. This means that an entry may not exist where the value of bsSourceGuardAddrType is unknown(0) and the value of bsSourceGuardAddrMACAddr is 00:00:00:00:00:00. If an entry indicates only an internet address, Source Guard will allow that address regardless of MAC address. Note that currently, MAC addresses are not supported. This means that currently, the value of bsSourceGuardAddrMACAddr must always by 00:00:00:00:00:00, and the value of bsSourceGuardAddrType must not be unknown(0).

bsSourceGuardAddrEntry.name: bsSourceGuardAddrEntry
bsSourceGuardAddrEntry.description: An entry containing an address allowed by Source Guard on an interface.

bsSourceGuardAddrIndex.name: bsSourceGuardAddrIndex
bsSourceGuardAddrIndex.description: The ifIndex value of the interface.

bsSourceGuardAddrType.name: bsSourceGuardAddrType
bsSourceGuardAddrType.description: The type of internet address contained in the corresponding instance of bsSourceGuardAddrAddress. If the value of this object is other(0), then the corresponding instance of bsSourceGuardAddrAddress must be a zero length value.

bsSourceGuardAddrAddress.name: bsSourceGuardAddrAddress
bsSourceGuardAddrAddress.description: The internet address allowed by Source Guard on this interface. If this object contains a zero length value, then the Source Guard feature will not use the value.

bsSourceGuardAddrMACAddr.name: bsSourceGuardAddrMACAddr
bsSourceGuardAddrMACAddr.description: The ethernet MAC address allowed by Source Guard on this interface. If this object contains the value 00:00:00:00:00:00, then the Source Guard feature will not use the value.

bsSourceGuardAddrSource.name: bsSourceGuardAddrSource
bsSourceGuardAddrSource.description: The source of the address(es). Currently, the only source is from dhcp snooping. In the future, static addresses will be allowed.

bsSourceGuardStatsEntry.name: bsSourceGuardStatsEntry
bsSourceGuardStatsEntry.description: An entry containing Source Guard statistics for an interface.

bsSourceGuardStatsIfIndex.name: bsSourceGuardStatsIfIndex
bsSourceGuardStatsIfIndex.description: The ifIndex value of the interface.

bsSourceGuardStatsDroppedPackets.name: bsSourceGuardStatsDroppedPackets
bsSourceGuardStatsDroppedPackets.description: The number of received packets on this interface that were dropped due to IP source guard filtering.

bsSourceGuardReachedMaxIpEntries.name: bsSourceGuardReachedMaxIpEntries
bsSourceGuardReachedMaxIpEntries.description: This notification is generated when the maximum number of IP entries on a port has been reached. The port is identified by the instance of bssourceGuardConfigMode included in the notification.

bsSourceGuardCannotEnablePort.name: bsSourceGuardCannotEnablePort
bsSourceGuardCannotEnablePort.description: This notification is generated when there are insufficient resources available to enable IP source guard checking on a port. Note that this notification will *not* be generated as the result of a management operation, but rather only as a result of internal state changes within the system (for example, system initialization). The port for which the notification is generated is identified by the instance of bsSourceGuardConfigMode included in the notification.
